subdefinitions.definition: To lift or lift up (something, especially a heavy object ).
examples: He hefted the sack of concrete into the truck.

subdefinitions.definition: To test the weight of (something) by lifting. ( figurative ) To evaluate or test (someone or something).

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To have ( substantial ) weight; to weigh .

secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To have ( substantial ) weight; to weigh .

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) simple past and past participle of heave [16th–17th c.]

main_definition: ( obsolete ) simple past and past participle of heave [16th–17th c.]

subdefinitions.definition: ( agriculture ) To accustom (a flock or group of farm animals , chiefly cattle or sheep ) to a piece of pastureland .
( figurative ) To establish or settle (someone) in an occupation or place of residence . To establish or plant (something) firmly in a place; to fix , to root , to settle.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , reflexive ) Of a thing : to establish or settle itself in a place.

secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , reflexive ) Of a thing : to establish or settle itself in a place.

definitions.definition: To cause ( milk ) to be held in a cow 's udder until the latter becomes hard and swollen , either by not milking the cow or by stopping up the teats , to make the cow look healthy ; also, to cause (a cow) to have an udder in this condition .
To cause ( urine ) to be held in a person 's bladder .

main_definition: ( agriculture ) To cause ( milk ) to be held in a cow 's udder until the latter becomes hard and swollen , either by not milking the cow or by stopping up the teats , to make the cow look healthy ; also, to cause (a cow) to have an udder in this condition .
secondary_definitions: ( by extension ) To cause ( urine ) to be held in a person 's bladder .
